docs.text: Example: a volcano plot example nih-cfde/training-rstudio-binder#3 A volcano plot example example # set working directory to `training-rstudio-binder/GTEx/` # install.packages("ggplot2") library(ggplot2) results <- read.table("./data/GTEx_Heart_20-29_vs_50-59.tsv") ggplot(results, aes(x = logFC, y = -log10(adj.P.Val))) + geom_point(aes(color = ifelse( adj.P.Val < 0.05, "p < 0.05", "NS"))) + geom_hline(yintercept = -log10(0.05)) + theme(legend.position = "bottom") + labs(color = "20-29 vs 50-59 year olds", subtitle = "Heart Tissue Gene Expression") Categories This example belongs to the following categories: R ggplot2 functions
docs.title: Example: a volcano plot example

docs.text: nih-cfde/training-rstudio-binder#3 A volcano plot example example # set working directory to `training-rstudio-binder/GTEx/` # install.packages("ggplot2") library(ggplot2) results <- read.table("./data/GTEx_Heart_20-29_vs_50-59.tsv") ggplot(results, aes(x = logFC, y = -log10(adj.P.Val))) + geom_point(aes(color = ifelse( adj.P.Val < 0.05, "p < 0.05", "NS"))) + geom_hline(yintercept = -log10(0.05)) + theme(legend.position = "bottom") + labs(color = "20-29 vs 50-59 year olds", subtitle = "Heart Tissue Gene Expression")

docs.text: Example: binder.pangeo.io binder links connection timing out nih-cfde/training-rstudio-binder#4 I was looking through the Conda introduction and clicked on the binder document within the link . The webpage to load the binder document timed out. I then tried an original binder document like below which loaded fine. https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/nih-cfde/training-rstudio-binder/conda-workshop-march2021?urlpath=rstudio
